Diagnosis:
12/1/24 Left mastectomy with axillary lymph node dissection
10.8cm Grade 2 invasive lobular carcinoma with 3 positive nodes from 21 sampled
Estrogen receptor positive (8/8), Progesterone receptor positive (7/8), HER2 negative
Stage T3N1M0
Proposed for adjuvant chemotherapy (FEC-T protocol)

PMH - Severe rheumatoid arthritis on biological therapy
DH - Adalimumab 40mg fortnightly, methotrexate 20mg weekly, folic acid 5mg weekly. Notable allergies: severe reaction to dexamethasone (anaphylaxis requiring resuscitation), multiple antiemetic allergies including metoclopramide and cyclizine
SH - Primary school teacher, currently off work. Lives with husband. Never smoker
Menopausal status - post-menopausal
FH - Sister with breast cancer age 52

Urgent referral received for this patient with complex steroid requirements prior to planned adjuvant chemotherapy. [redacted name] has documented severe hypersensitivity to dexamethasone with previous anaphylactic episode requiring emergency intervention. Given her high-risk disease features and clear indication for adjuvant chemotherapy, we need to establish a safe steroid protocol before treatment initiation.

Proposed steroid alternatives to evaluate:
? Methylprednisolone
? Hydrocortisone
? Betamethasone
? Prednisolone
? Alternative anti-emetic combinations

Given the time-critical nature of adjuvant therapy, we aim to complete steroid challenge testing within 2 weeks to enable chemotherapy initiation by early February 2024. Earliest possible appointment would be appreciated.
